image.altText: three aboriginal women holding a photo of a respected elder woman

props.synopsis: These First Nation educators say the Australian schooling system is failing Indigenous kids. They're offering solutions — and are calling on governments to listen.

title.children: As education gap widens, First Nations educators say their communities have answers

image.altText: A high shot of Linda Reynolds in a media scrum answering questions outside the WA Supreme Court in Perth.

props.synopsis: It's unusual in Australia for MPs to resort to defamation proceedings, since parliamentary privilege allows them to speak freely in parliament without fear of legal action — but Senator Linda Reynolds felt it was the only way to repair her reputation.

title.children: A victory for Linda Reynolds in defamation battle with Brittany Higgins might not give her what she wants

image.altText: People swim at a beach next to the buildings of a nuclear plant.

props.synopsis: Canada's biggest province generates 51 per cent of its power from nuclear and while some love it, there are still downstream issues to be solved.

title.children: Big nuclear is on the Coalition agenda but Ontario, Canada shows there are still issues to resolve

image.altText: Li Na Lei and Qian Yang playing doubles para table tennis for Australia at the Paralympics

props.synopsis: Australia's para table tennis duo Li Na Lei and Qian Yang have won gold in the women's doubles WD20 at the Paralympics. Amanda Reid wins back-to-back gold medals in the women's C1-3 500m time trial. Follow live.

title.children: Lei and Yang win gold in para table tennis, Amanda Reid defends Paralympic title

image.altText: DJ Fatman Scoop smiles for camera

props.synopsis: Fatman Scoop, who topped charts in Europe with Be Faithful two decades ago and later contributed to hits by other artists, died after collapsing on stage at a show Friday in Connecticut, according to officials and his family.

title.children: Rapper Fatman Scoop dies at 53 after collapsing on stage in Connecticut

image.altText: A middle-aged woman readies a small dripper of liquid for a small child lying on a bed next to some pink balloons.

props.synopsis: Children began receiving vaccines on Saturday, Gaza's health ministry said, a day before the large-scale rollout and first three-day "humanitarian pause" in fighting agreed to by Israel and the UN's World Health Organization.

title.children: Children in Gaza begin receiving polio vaccine, while hostilities continue to worsen in occupied West Bank

image.altText: A scenic view of rocks and mountains with the silhouette of a fighter jet flying low in the bright blue sky.

props.synopsis: Dramatic vision has emerged of an Australian F-35 jet performing risky, low-level tactical manoeuvres above the national park, in an incident believed to have raised eyebrows among senior air force figures.

title.children: Video shows jet performing daring flight manoeuvres, believed to have raised eyebrows among senior air force figures

image.altText: Manoa Ravouvou

props.synopsis: Almost a million tourists come to Fiji every year. But behind the sun and sand, there's a dark side to the islands, with cartels using Fiji to import drugs into lucrative markets — a drug problem that has now spread into communities.

title.children: It's Manar's job to protect his village in Fiji. The Mexican drug cartels have other ideas

image.altText: LGBT flag

props.synopsis: The prime minister says his government has not changed its policy on questions for the next census, despite being forced to clean up a messy debate over how the nation's LGBTQI+ community will be counted in the next survey.

title.children: Albanese insists Labor has not changed stance on LGBTQI+ questions in census

image.altText: The entrance to the Royal Lodge at Windsor Park

props.synopsis: For years, King Charles and Prince Andrew have been at odds over a sweetheart deal cut between Andrew and his late mother to give him lifelong possession of a grand mansion on the grounds of Windsor Castle.

title.children: Forget William and Harry. The real brotherly feud to watch right now is between Charles and Andrew

image.altText: A woman sits in a chair while her nails are filed at a salon in Melbourne.

props.synopsis: If you've been to a nail salon in Australia, chances are it was owned by a Vietnamese Australian. So, where did it all begin?

title.children: How Vietnamese Australians came to dominate the nail salon industry

image.altText: A video still of Tom Gleeson behind a podium. The ABC lissajous in the top left corner and the Hard Quiz logo in the top right

props.synopsis: Oh, you're back? Something to prove after last week's effort? Let's see what you've got.

title.children: Always said you'd smash Hard Quiz? I'll believe it when I see it

image.altText: A photo of Starbucks CEO Brian Niccol is surrounded by highlighted print documents

props.synopsis: The new Starbucks boss gets a jet for his commute — but that's just a sweetener.

title.children: Why it cost Starbucks $100m and a jet-fueled commute to poach its new CEO

image.altText: A composite image shows headshots of Kamala Harris and Donald Trump

props.synopsis: As the energy around Kamala Harris's nomination settles and she emerges from her first real test, the strategy behind Republican attack ads becomes clear, writes Jade Macmillan.

title.children: As Kamala Harris emerges from a major interview, the Republican plan against her crystallises

image.altText: A roll of barbed wire atop a prison wall at night.

props.synopsis: The mother of a boy who died by suicide while being held in youth detention in WA says he will be deeply missed by his family and the juvenile justice system in the state is "failing all youths regardless of race".

title.children: ‘The system has failed’: Mother of boy who took his own life at Banksia Hill speaks out

image.altText: Flower beds in full bloom.

props.synopsis: September's arrival signals the beginning of spring in Australia. But not everywhere follows the same system when it comes to changing seasons.

title.children: September 1 marks the beginning of spring in Australia. But how are the seasons measured elsewhere?

image.altText: Gold medallist Emily Petricola of Australia celebrates on the podium.

props.synopsis: Emily Petricola broke a world record and defended her C4 3,000m pursuit Paralympic crown. But the para cycling champion had her Paris dream threatened twice in the lead-up to the Games.

title.children: Petricola overcomes MS flare and bike crash to win gold again

image.altText: Chris O'Connell leans on his haunches

props.synopsis: Chris O'Connell was blown off the court by the number one seed Jannik Sinner, who avoided the fate of Novak Djokovic and Carlos Alcaraz to march into the second week.

title.children: Chris O'Connell's US Open run ended by Jannik Sinner

image.altText: Alexei Popyrin clenches both fists and screams in delight

props.synopsis: Alexei Popyrin claims the biggest win of his career, defeating Novak Djokovic in four sets at the US Open to move into the fourth round of a grand slam for the first time.

title.children: Alexei Popyrin downs Novak Djokovic as young Aussie soars to new heights at US Open

image.altText: An older man wearing hi-vis coat smiles, photographed from the side, against a grey sky

props.synopsis: Scientists are concerned that a toxic herbicide widely used in Australian farming could be linked to the growing prevalence of Parkinson's disease. It sat on the regulator's shelf for review for decades, while the company manufacturing it worked to publicly discredit evidence that its product was harmful.

title.children: Parkinson's has been called the silent pandemic, and scientists believe a common farm chemical could be one cause

image.altText: F1 drivers Oscar Piastri, Lando Norris and George Russell standing arm in arm

props.synopsis: Oscar Piastri will start Sunday's Italian Grand Prix from second, joining teammate Lando Norris in a front row lockout for McLaren.

title.children: Piastri qualifies second in Italy as F1 world championship fight intensifies

image.altText: Fireball burning from a Greek oil tanker in the Red Sea.

props.synopsis: The ship, which was attacked by Houthi rebels in the Red Sea, has been on fire for a week as officials try to recover the tanker and avoid an environmental disaster.

title.children: A burning tanker could be about to drop a million barrels of oil into the Red Sea

image.altText: A table full of teenagers look at the camera

props.synopsis: Seth Rogan, James Franco, Judd Apatow and more launched their careers with a show that was cancelled after one season. But Freaks and Geeks has become a bona fide cult classic.

title.children: Watching Freaks and Geeks now is like looking into a crystal ball for future Hollywood A-listers

image.altText: A young white boy running through a field after a young white girl

props.synopsis: There are two important questions confronting any parents with young kids: are you giving them autonomy and have you equipped them with the competence to be truly and safely independent?

title.children: A mum being reported to social services for letting her teen travel Europe is a sad sign of today's risk-averse parenting

image.altText: A man in a suit smiles at the camera, while standing next to a vacant block of land.

props.synopsis: Götene has a population problem, and in a bid to attract new residents, it's almost giving away blocks of land. The "wild plan" has gone viral online, and the town mayor hopes it could put the forgotten town back on the map.

title.children: This Scandi town is selling land for the price of a coffee, but is it too good to be true?

image.altText: A man holding a painted stick in bushland

props.synopsis: Traditional owners share their knowledge to ward off the native animals after 16 high-risk dingo interactions this year.

title.children: K'gari visitors use Indigenous traditional method to protect themselves from dingoes

image.altText: The cuple in white and pick in a portrait embrace

props.synopsis: Learn all of the controversies surrounding the newest Norwegian royal couple, before they tie the knot this weekend.

title.children: A Norwegian princess and a shaman to the stars will marry this weekend. Here's why their nuptials have angered local media

image.altText: Mental Health Public Entry sign.

props.synopsis: The ABC has confirmed 19 adult mental health inpatients have ended their own lives while in Queensland mental health units since 2018.

title.children: Urgent call to upgrade Queensland's mental health units as ABC confirms 19 inpatient suicides in six years

image.altText: Bruce Highway explosion

props.synopsis: A section of the Bruce Highway is closed, adding about four hours for motorists with diversions in place.

title.children: Bruce Highway south of Gladstone to remain closed after truck explosion

image.altText: wintery day in tasmania as snow and dark clouds mover across a mountain

props.synopsis: The extreme weather variability observed across Australia in late August will become even more pronounced through the first days of spring.

title.children: Spring snow heading to south-east Australia as record run of winter heat comes to an end

image.altText: Photo illustration of Anna Marie Gewargis, another covering her face and childrens blocks to the right

props.synopsis: An ABC investigation has revealed how a 31-year-old woman swindled parents, investors and even her landlord in an illegal childcare scheme across Sydney.

title.children: 'She's a master manipulator': The illegal childcare centre that left an investor and parents $275k out of pocket

image.altText: Elon Musk

props.synopsis: Brazil has started blocking Elon Musk's social media platform X, making it largely inaccessible there on both the web and through mobile apps, following the billionaire's refusal to identify a legal representative in the country.

title.children: Brazil begins blocking Elon Musk's social media platform X

image.altText: Woman with glasses smiling at camera

props.synopsis: Emma McKeon has opened up about her struggles with swimming, after announcing Paris will be her last Olympic Games.

title.children: Australia's most decorated Olympian Emma McKeon ponders life beyond the pool after announcing Olympic retirement
